issues: Coordinate discrepancy: 4.53km difference between asserted coordinates and geocoded location for 'USA: Michigan, Lake City'
Major semantic conflict: env_broad_scale claims 'temperate woodland biome' but sample is from agricultural switchgrass field with fertilization
Environmental hierarchy mismatch: woodland biome → agricultural field → farm soil creates logical inconsistency
Land cover conflict: Inferred land cover shows forest/woodland systems (deciduous broadleaf, savannas) conflicting with asserted agricultural ecosystem
Elevation discrepancy: 129m difference between asserted (500m) and geospatial lookup (371m)
Ecosystem classification inconsistency: Claims 'temperate woodland biome' but describes fertilized switchgrass agricultural system
Soil type mismatch: Inferred podzol soil type doesn't align well with typical agricultural farm soil expectations
recommendations: Verify and correct coordinates - either use geocoded coordinates (44.335287, -85.215046) for Lake City center or update geo_loc_name to reflect actual sampling location
Correct env_broad_scale to agricultural biome or cropland biome (e.g., ENVO:01000245 'anthropogenic terrestrial biome') to match the fertilized switchgrass agricultural context
Update environmental hierarchy for consistency: agricultural biome → agricultural field → farm soil makes logical sense
Verify elevation measurement - confirm if 500m is correct for this location or use geospatial-derived 371m
Consider adding more specific location details to geo_loc_name if coordinates represent a specific field rather than Lake City center
Validate soil classification - confirm if podzol is appropriate for this agricultural setting or if different soil characterization is needed
Review study methodology to ensure environmental classification aligns with actual sampling from fertilized agricultural switchgrass plots
